result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jovon Levann Williams

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jovon Levann Williams in court.  Attorney Michael F Torphy in court for Jovon Levann Williams. Attorney Amy E Spanczak appeared in court on behalf of  Attorney Jon R Josephsen Jr. for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Return of Property hearing with Defendant's other case 22CF2304. Discussion placed on the record. For reasons stated on the record, Defense moves to WITHDRAW petition for return of property. State did not object. No further issues needed to be addressed at this time. Court orders case adjourned for final pretrial and jury trial before Br 16.

Final pre-trial scheduled for January 17, 2023 at 10:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for January 23, 2023 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Jovon Levann Williams appeared by video.  Attorney Michael F Torphy in court for Jovon Levann Williams.  Attorney Jon R Josephsen Jr. in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Status Conference. Defense counsel informs court that they have received discovery materials and an offer from the State. Further, defense requests Final Pretrial, Jury Trial, and Return of Property hearing dates. Any witness lists, special jury instructions, and motion in limine to be filed by 01/10/2022. Court orders case adjourned for final pretrial, jury trial, and return of property dates before Br 16.
Final pre-trial scheduled for January 17, 2023 at 10:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for January 23, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Return of property hearing scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Received and Filed. Petition for the Return of Property

Defendant Jovon Levann Williams appeared by video.  Attorney Michael F Torphy appeared by video for Jovon Levann Williams.  Attorney Annie Louk for Jon R Josephsen Jr. in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status conference.  Defense received most of discovery and requested more time for review.  Court granted defense's request.  Defense to file petition of return of property; requested return of phones.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 16; VIA ZOOM.  Status conference scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jovon Levann Williams in court with attorney Michael F Torphy.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a scheduling conference.  Defense requests an adjournment.  Court scheduled the matter as requested.  Matter will be held via Zoom.  Case adjourned to Branch 16, Rm 503 CH.  Status conference scheduled for August 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jovon Levann Williams in court with Attorney Michael F Torphy.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer B. Spitzer. Court took judicial notice of 10CF2677. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 16.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Michael F Torphy in court, appear by video.  Thomas Potter appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. Defendant Williams in custody with MPD. Case set Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jovon Levann Williams in court with Attorney Michael F Torphy.  John Daniel Flynn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is not present; was not served. Defense moves to dismiss; motion is taken under advisement. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered the remaining cash bail to be returned to the remitter.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription and no dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Jovon Levann Williams in court with attorney Michael F Torphy.  Jack T Eichorst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 4/20/22 @ 1p
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 4/20/22 @ 1:30p
